title: Worker Hygiene
description: Comprehensive worker hygiene requirements including toilet facilities, hand washing stations, personal hygiene practices, protective garments, health monitoring, and hygiene behavior controls

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities adequate in number and location? A ZERO POINT (NON-CONFORMANCE) DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THIS AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are adequate in number for worker population
Toilet-to-worker ratio meets or exceeds regulatory requirements
Toilets are conveniently located for worker access
Distance from work areas allows reasonable access time
Separate facilities for different gender workers where required
Portable toilets used where permanent facilities not available
Facility adequacy reviewed as workforce changes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of toilet adequacy relative to workforce size and regulations
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly assessment of toilet adequacy, immediate addition if insufficient

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities located where they are not a risk of contamination to product, packaging, equipment, water sources and growing areas?
mandatoryStatements: Toilets are located away from product handling areas
Toilets do not present contamination risk to packaging or equipment
Toilet location prevents contamination of water sources
Toilets are not directly adjacent to growing areas
Adequate separation distance or barriers are provided
Toilet drainage does not pose contamination risk
Airflow patterns do not carry contamination from toilets to product areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual risk assessment of toilet facility locations
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing monitoring that toilet use does not create contamination risks

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities designed and maintained to prevent contamination (e.g., free from leaks and cracks)?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are structurally sound without cracks
No leaks from plumbing or waste systems
Facility design prevents contamination escape
Doors and vents function properly
Regular maintenance prevents deterioration
Repairs completed promptly when issues identified
Facility condition supports sanitary use
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of toilet facility condition
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily checks for leaks or damage, immediate repair of sanitation issues

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities constructed of materials that are easy to clean?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are constructed of smooth, cleanable materials
Materials are non-porous and non-absorbent
Surfaces can be effectively cleaned and sanitized
Construction materials resist moisture and deterioration
Facility design facilitates cleaning access
Materials are appropriate for sanitation facility use
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual assessment of toilet facility cleanability
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly verification that facilities can be effectively cleaned

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities supplied with toilet paper and is the toilet paper maintained properly (e.g., toilet paper rolls are not stored on the floor or in the urinals)?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are adequately stocked with toilet paper
Toilet paper is maintained in sanitary condition
Toilet paper is not stored on floor
Toilet paper is not stored in urinals or other unsanitary locations
Storage method protects toilet paper from contamination
Regular restocking prevents shortages
Toilet paper dispensers are clean and functional
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily verification that toilet facilities are properly stocked
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Multiple daily checks of toilet paper availability and proper storage

requirements.text: Where used, is there a documented procedure for emptying the waste holding tanks in a hygienic manner and also in a way that prevents product, packaging, equipment, water systems and growing area contamination?
mandatoryStatements: If portable toilets with holding tanks used, emptying procedure is documented
Procedure ensures hygienic emptying process
Procedure prevents contamination of product during emptying
Procedure prevents contamination of packaging, equipment, water sources
Procedure prevents growing area contamination
Emptying schedule is defined and followed
Service provider qualifications and procedures are verified
Emptying activities are performed when product handling not occurring
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of waste tank emptying records and procedure compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification before each emptying event that contamination prevention measures are in place

requirements.text: Are toilet facilities and hand washing stations clean and are there records showing cleaning, servicing and stocking is occurring regularly?
mandatoryStatements: Toilet facilities are maintained in clean condition
Hand washing stations are maintained clean
Cleaning records document facility cleaning frequency
Servicing records show regular maintenance activities
Stocking records demonstrate regular replenishment of supplies
Cleaning frequency is adequate for usage levels
Facilities are inspected and cleaned multiple times daily during peak use
Records show who cleaned facilities and when
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly review of toilet and hand washing station cleaning records
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Multiple daily inspections and cleaning of facilities, immediate attention to cleanliness issues

requirements.text: Is hand washing signage posted appropriately?
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing signage is posted at hand washing stations
Signs are posted at toilet facility exits
Signs are posted where entering product handling areas
Signage includes proper hand washing steps or reminders
Signs are in language(s) understood by workers
Signs use pictograms where appropriate for comprehension
Signage is clean, visible, and well-maintained
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly inspection of hand washing signage adequacy and placement
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monthly checks that signage is visible and in good condition

requirements.text: Are hand washing stations adequate in number and appropriately located for worker access and monitoring usage? A ZERO POINT (NON-CONFORMANCE) DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THIS AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing stations are adequate in number for workforce
Stations are located for convenient worker access
Stations are positioned to encourage hand washing compliance
Station location allows monitoring of usage
Stations are located near toilet facilities
Stations are located at entry points to product handling areas
Additional stations provided in growing and harvest areas as needed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual assessment of hand washing station adequacy and placement
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly review of station usage and adequacy, immediate addition if insufficient

requirements.text: Are hand washing stations in working order (no leaks, free of clogged drains, etc.) and restricted to hand washing purposes only?
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing stations are fully functional
No leaks from faucets, pipes, or fixtures
Drains are not clogged and water flows freely
Stations are used only for hand washing (not other cleaning)
Hot and cold water available (or warm water)
Soap dispensers and towel dispensers functional
Stations are maintained in good repair
Regular inspection ensures continued functionality
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection of hand washing station functionality
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate repair of non-functional stations, temporary alternative provided until repaired

requirements.text: Are hand wash stations clearly visible (e.g., situated outside the toilet facility) and easily accessible to workers?
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing stations are clearly visible to workers
Stations are situated outside toilet facilities where possible
Station placement does not require searching or backtracking
Stations are easily accessible without barriers
Station location encourages use
Workers can reach stations without delay
Visibility and accessibility support hand washing compliance
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly assessment of hand washing station visibility and accessibility
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Ongoing observation that stations are being used regularly

requirements.text: Are hand wash stations adequately stocked with unscented soap and paper towels?
mandatoryStatements: Hand washing stations are stocked with soap
Soap is unscented to prevent product contamination
Paper towels or other single-use hand drying method available
Supplies are adequate for worker population and usage
Regular restocking prevents shortages
Soap and towels are maintained in clean dispensers
Backup supplies readily available for restocking
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily verification that all hand washing stations are adequately stocked
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Multiple daily checks of supply levels, immediate restocking when low

requirements.text: Are workers washing and sanitizing their hands before starting work each day, after using the restroom, after breaks, before putting on gloves and whenever hands may be contaminated?
mandatoryStatements: Workers wash hands before starting work each day
Workers wash hands after using restroom
Workers wash hands after breaks
Workers wash hands before putting on gloves
Workers wash hands whenever hands may be contaminated
Hand washing includes proper technique and duration
Hand sanitizing is performed after washing where required
Supervisors monitor and enforce hand washing compliance
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily monitoring of worker hand washing compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous observation of hand washing behavior, immediate correction of non-compliance

requirements.text: Are secondary-hand sanitation stations (e.g., touch-free dispensers) adequate in number and location, and are the stations properly maintained?
mandatoryStatements: Secondary hand sanitation stations provided where needed
Stations are adequate in number for operations
Stations are located strategically in work areas
Touch-free dispensers used where possible
Stations are properly maintained and functional
Sanitizer is stocked and available
Sanitizer concentration is appropriate and effective
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of hand sanitation station adequacy and maintenance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily checks of sanitizer availability, immediate restocking when empty

requirements.text: Where there are foot baths, foamers or dry powdered sanitizing stations provided at entrances to growing areas, are the stations maintained properly?
mandatoryStatements: If foot sanitation stations used, they are properly maintained
Solution concentration is tested and maintained
Stations are cleaned and solution changed regularly
Dry powder stations are stocked and functional
Foam stations operate properly and are stocked
Station placement is appropriate for contamination control
Workers use stations as required
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection and testing of foot sanitation stations
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily checks of solution concentration and station functionality

requirements.text: Are workers' fingernails clean, short and free of nail polish?
mandatoryStatements: Workers maintain clean fingernails
Fingernails are kept short (not extending beyond fingertips)
No nail polish is worn by food handlers
No artificial nails or nail extensions worn
Grooming standards are defined in hygiene policy
Supervisors monitor compliance with nail standards
Non-compliance is corrected immediately
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of worker fingernail compliance during inspections
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring by supervisors, immediate correction of violations

requirements.text: Are workers who are working directly or indirectly with food free from signs of boils, sores, open wounds and are not exhibiting signs of foodborne illness?
mandatoryStatements: Workers with boils, sores, or open wounds are restricted from food handling
Wounds are properly covered with waterproof bandage if worker continues
Workers showing signs of illness are restricted from work
Illness signs include vomiting, diarrhea, fever, jaundice, sore throat with fever
Daily health checks identify ill or injured workers
Ill workers are excluded until cleared per health policy
Wound coverings are monitored for integrity during work
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily health screening of workers before starting work
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring for signs of illness or injury, immediate restriction of affected workers

requirements.text: Are workers not observed wearing watches, jewelry (plain band permitted), studs, false eyelashes, false fingernails, etc.?
mandatoryStatements: Workers do not wear watches in food handling areas
Jewelry is not worn except plain wedding band
No earrings, studs, or body jewelry worn
No false eyelashes or eyelash extensions worn
No false fingernails or nail extensions worn
Policy on personal items is documented and communicated
Supervisors enforce personal items policy
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of workers for prohibited personal items
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring, immediate removal of prohibited items

requirements.text: Are all workers wearing protective outer garments suitable for the operation (e.g., appropriate clean clothes, smocks, aprons, sleeves and non-latex gloves)?
mandatoryStatements: Workers wear protective outer garments appropriate for their tasks
Garments include smocks, aprons, or sleeves as required
Gloves are worn where appropriate (non-latex to prevent allergen issues)
Protective garments are clean at start of shift
Garments provide adequate protection for product safety
Garment requirements are defined for each work area/task
Adequate supply of clean garments is maintained
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of worker protective garment compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring, immediate provision of required garments if missing

requirements.text: Do workers remove protective outer garments (e.g., smocks, aprons, sleeves, and gloves) when on break, before using the toilets and when going home at the end of their shift?
mandatoryStatements: Workers remove protective garments before breaks
Workers remove garments before using toilets
Workers remove garments when leaving at end of shift
Garment removal prevents contamination outside work areas
Procedure for garment removal is communicated to workers
Supervisors monitor compliance with garment removal policy
Clean garments provided after breaks and toilet use
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of garment removal compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring at break areas and toilet entrances

requirements.text: Is there a designated area for workers to leave protective outer garments (e.g., smocks, aprons, sleeves, and gloves) when on break and before using the toilets?
mandatoryStatements: Designated area exists for storing protective garments
Area is located outside work zones
Area is near break areas and toilet facilities
Hooks, bins, or storage method prevents contamination
Area keeps garments separated from personal items
Storage area is clean and maintained
Workers know where to store garments
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly verification of garment storage area adequacy and cleanliness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly inspection of storage area condition

requirements.text: Are worker personal items being stored in such a way that they are not a potential food safety risk to product, growing area, equipment or materials?
mandatoryStatements: Workers' personal items are stored away from product areas
Designated storage area provided for personal belongings
Storage lockers or area prevents contamination risk
Personal items not stored in growing, production, or storage areas
Food, beverages, medicines kept separate from work areas
Storage area is clean and organized
Policy prohibits personal items in production areas
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection that personal items properly stored
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily checks that no personal items in production areas

requirements.text: Where required, are workers wearing effective hair restraints that contain all hair?
mandatoryStatements: Workers wear hair restraints where required
Hair restraints effectively contain all hair
Restraints include hair nets, caps, or other effective coverings
Facial hair is also restrained where required
Hair restraints are worn properly (no hair protruding)
Requirements for hair restraints defined by work area/task
Compliance monitored by supervisors
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of hair restraint compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring, immediate correction if hair not properly restrained

requirements.text: Are all items removed from garment (shirt, blouse, etc.) top pockets, and unsecured items are not worn (e.g., pens, glasses on top of head, Bluetooth devices, etc.)?
mandatoryStatements: Workers remove items from top pockets before entering work areas
No pens or writing instruments in pockets
Glasses not worn on top of head
Bluetooth devices not worn loosely
No unsecured items that could fall into product
Policy on pocket items is communicated
Supervisors enforce pocket item policy
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily observation of workers for prohibited pocket items
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring, immediate removal of loose items

requirements.text: Is smoking, eating, chewing and drinking confined to designated areas, and spitting is prohibited in all areas?
mandatoryStatements: Smoking is confined to designated smoking areas away from production
Eating is confined to designated break areas
Chewing gum/tobacco is confined to break areas
Drinking is confined to break areas (except water at designated stations)
Spitting is strictly prohibited in all areas
Designated areas are clearly marked
Policy is communicated and enforced
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily monitoring of compliance with eating/smoking policy
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous observation, immediate correction of violations

requirements.text: Is fresh potable drinking water in clean containers readily accessible to workers?
mandatoryStatements: Fresh potable drinking water is provided to workers
Water is readily accessible during work hours
Water containers are clean and sanitary
Adequate quantity of water for workforce
Water is cool/refreshing especially in hot conditions
Water sources do not present contamination risk to product
Workers can access water without excessive delay
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily verification that drinking water is available and accessible
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Multiple daily checks of water availability and container cleanliness

requirements.text: Are single use cups provided (unless a drinking fountain is used) and made available near the drinking water?
mandatoryStatements: Single use disposable cups provided at water stations
Cups are made available near drinking water
Adequate supply of cups maintained
Alternative: drinking fountain with sanitary design used
Cups stored in sanitary manner
Used cups disposed of properly
Cup supply restocked regularly
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily verification that cups are adequately stocked
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Multiple daily checks of cup availability

requirements.text: Are first aid kits adequately stocked and readily available to workers?
mandatoryStatements: First aid kits are available and accessible to workers
Kits are adequately stocked with appropriate supplies
Kits include bandages, antiseptic, and other basic first aid items
Waterproof bandages available for food handlers
First aid kit locations are clearly marked
Kits are inspected and restocked regularly
Workers know where first aid kits are located
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly inspection of first aid kit contents and accessibility
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly verification of kit adequacy, immediate restocking of depleted items

capaInject: If toilet facilities inadequate: immediate addition of facilities or reduction of workforce, permanent solution within 30 days
If toilet location creates contamination risk: immediate risk assessment, relocation or barriers within 60 days
If hand washing stations inadequate or non-functional: immediate addition or repair, temporary stations until permanent solution
If workers not washing hands properly: immediate retraining, enhanced monitoring, disciplinary action for repeat violations
If workers have uncovered wounds or show illness signs: immediate exclusion from food handling, medical clearance required before return
If workers wearing prohibited items: immediate removal of items, retraining on policy
If drinking water not available: immediate provision of potable water, permanent solution within 24 hours
traceabilityInject: Toilet and hand washing station cleaning records must be traceable to specific times and personnel
Worker health screening must be documented while complying with privacy laws
First aid kit inspections must be traceable to specific dates and inventory checks
Worker hygiene violations must be documented with corrective actions
